dialogue: Shhh!
Go go go.
Three months ago?
Yeah, it’s ripped-- I have like, 20/20 vision.
I caught my wing on that door handle!
That’s paranoid--
They need to change that! I mean look at this! Look at this gaping hole--
You need to change your costume, Shelly!
I am, I will, I just-- ugh, look at this.
I love this darn wing.
Gimme your shoes.
You know, of all the costumes in the whole show, these are the oldest wings. Shoot. Ida’s gonna kill me.
Because you keep losing rhinestones and feathers-- Where’s your clip-ons?
It’s just so disappointing. Lemons and now this.
Oh, they’re just so expensive recently.
Clip-ons, SHELLY!
They’re right there, sweetie.
Okay can you please put them on?

Yes, I’m doing it, jeez. They’re like eighty-nine cents a piece, which I just think-- it’s-- it’s lemons-- it’s not even really food, you know? It’s like a garnish or it’s, you know, it’s like herbs-- it’s like accessories--
Let’s go--
Well I’m buying some nice salmon steaks for dinner cuz I’m entertaining tomorrow, and there’s this beautiful picture of-- of these salmon steaks in the Ina Garten cookbook?
Music is changing!!
And there are lovely thin lemon slices on the-- on the salmon, and so I do. I need them, I need the lemons.
Shelly, you’ve got the wrong clip ons!
When did they put that door handle in anyway like two weeks ago?
It was three months ago.
I always forget it’s there.
That’s cuz you’re old!
I’m older, I’m not actually that old--
C’mon, c’mon.
I wish that hadn’t happened. I wish I could go back in time, see that door handle, say to myself “Ope, there’s that terrible door handle, it’s right there” and then, you know, just not have--
I want to learn French one day.
I love languages. I can say “Je m’appelle Jodie.” I know how to say “My Name Is Jodie” in five languages.
--Including English-- Useless?? Are you kidding??
Sisters, sure, I can see that--
No like, you’re our mom... and Eddie’s--
I mean, I guess I think of us as a family.
I knew when we started sharing our theater, when they took over our Thursday, Friday and Saturday performances, it was a bad sign.
No no no, our show is legendary.
...Hey. She looks out at the view too.
If they just pumped a little more money into our advertising campaign... I mean our shots are from the early eighties...
Aren’t you in some of those shots?
I am...
You had the Hindenburg solo.
I did...
How long did you do it?
Um... when I was cast in ‘87 until about ‘99 when Renata joined the cast-- then she took it over.
I bet you were great...
Did you ever want to get married?
I was married for a short time when I was really young.
What happened?

Oh you know, it didn’t work out-- I was dancing-- I was already in the show here when we met, and he didn’t like it so much-- Vegas. And then he got a job in New York, but the show here was really thriving-- there was a lot of press around us-- it was so exciting and I was very young-- so I stayed here.
So what did you do?

We tried to make it work for a couple years but he eventually met someone there. He asked me if I’d consider trying to dance in New York, and I did-- I tried it. I went to an open call for the Rockettes, I went to an open call for a Broadway musical, but... I really, I just missed the thrill of the show here...
You’d be a perfect Rockette.
Nah, I found all that kicking very redundant.

Hey Hannie! Oh I just tried to call you Hannah and honey at the same time-- Hannie-- haha-- anyway, Hi Hannah, honey. Just wanted to check in and say hello and see if you’d want to meet me for a bite or a cup of coffee-- or well, I don’t drink coffee but I could have some tea-- or, what I’d really like is a nice drink but that’s... that’d be inappropriate ‘cause you’re only... you’re not old enou-- you’re only twenty... oh shit. Oh shit, you’re twenty two-- oh my god, how do I delete this thing...?
Oh shut up...
I went to a dance call today.
You did? Already?
Um, it was this show called Hedonist Paradise?
Ugh, I can’t believe that’s the title of a show.
Le Razzle Dazzle is a name that is evocative of-- of another time in history, of Paris, of the theater in a way--
Well what do you get from “Hedonist Paradise”? I get girls grinding on poles, doused in water-- like animals--just totally tasteless--
Yes!
Well, Mary-Anne, you think it’s so terrible, why are you here? Why did you want this job in the first place you think it’s so tasteless?
You wanna see the combination?
Oh there’s a chair involved.
Okay so you’re backward on the chair and then you’re like: “A git it git it come on.” Slap thighs, up the body, through the hair, hold. And one two three four, and ass ass uh-uh.
This is ridiculous.
And body roll, body roll, then you get up, and pose.
And butt and butt hip, then down the leg, and up and up, and duhn.
And hump the chair uh-uh-uh-uh￾
Sorry sweetie.
It’s okay.
Never.
Okay.
You know, how am I supposed to react??
I saw it.
You did?
Yeah. It was pretty awesome.
Awesome? The dirty circus was awesome?
It was really funny--
Uh-huh?
And the acts were really hard and impressive.
Sounds like every other circus.
I’ve never seen a circus like that.
And that made it awesome?
I mean, yeah...
What?
Which ones?
And what were the others?
Sweetie, you don’t even want those shows, they’re so bad, they’re low class--
This show-- this was a famous show, it was a tradition that had it’s roots in France--!
It’s true! This show is the last remaining descendent of 1830’s Parisian lido culture and that is-- it is history!

And just like the shows in Paris-- you know, we think 85 is a big cast, but there were 160 of us back in the ‘80’s! American Express did a travel campaign in -- in ‘87 or ‘88, and we were flown all over the world and photographed in different sites-- They shot me on the Great Wall of China-- I was very special!!

Vegas treated us like movie stars? The Iconic American Show Girl. The Las Vegas Showgirl. We were ambassadors, we represented elegance and grace, we had status, It was a real legacy, and it still is! I mean, these costumes-- they make you feel like you’re stepping out of the pages of Vogue magazine. I think that’s why women come to see the show-- I think the glamour is undeniable.
Maybe times have just changed but--
Oh my god, Hannah! What a nice surprise! Come on in! What are you doing here?
Hey sweetie. What are you doing here?
I just... I just wanted to come over...?
Okay...
Can I come in?
Is everything okay? It’s just not a good time right now.
It’s just-- my mom-- She won’t answer my calls-- and I want to talk to her?
Your mom’s just sad that you left like that. You left.
I know but I still want to talk to her--
You know what, it’s just a bad time right now--
Shelly, I’m really scared-- I didn’t know I could never go back--
I CAN’T SEE YOU RIGHT NOW! I need you to go, I need to be alone, I’m doing something!
I just wanted to call you-- I want to talk to you-- I can’t believe I left the way I did the other night, I just feel so terrible.
Is this the worst audience ever?? I just want to yell at them: WAKE UP! This is a LIVE PERFORMANCE! What is this boring? It’s breasts and rhinestones and joy!
How did you do this before I was here? For thirty years-- how did you make all your quick changes??
I’m so glad you feel so necessary here, Jodie-- that’s good. That’s important.
Do you hear where we’re at? They listen to the monitor-- it’s like ridiculous climactic movie music.
Can you help me with my necklace?
No, I want to see you get ready by yourself. I want to see what would happen to you if I didn’t help.
Oh god, okay, fine. Look.
Good. You’re always behind too.
Well, good luck.
I’m slightly concerned-- with the wings it’s gonna be a little tight--
Well my god, stop yelling at me, I’m gonna get anxious!
Will you just help me with my damn wings??
Nope.
You should have thought of this pointless challenge before the show, so I was ready for it.
Well here’s your warning for tomorrow.
Yeah, thanks a lot!
This is good, this is character building.
Just what I need, a lesson about character from a nineteen year old.
I got it!!! Haha!!
See??
Good!! I’m glad you can get into your costumes alone--
Ohhh!!! Oh noooo!
What did you do??
I ripped it up.
I had this dream the other night that I could speak French... I was really-- I was speaking French. Really speaking it. And I-- I understood everything...
You should go to France.
Ha! Yeah, maybe I should...
Oh you should. You should!
Really! What’s stopping you? You should do it, you should.
The next chapter will be different.
